title: Unpopular opinion: After looking at new Akali im now certain
body:

I've always found Yasuo to be the most exciting to play against. He forces you to be an active player just because of how he interacts with your own minions. I guess most mage players are just autopilot farmbots that sometimes wander to other lanes, though..

If the mage dies before their abilities are up again then I don't see how you're refuting what they said.

yep, his 0 second cooldown E mobility spell, point and click crowd control if you're in flash + E range, Passive that negates entire abilties and a windwall that he can keep as a get out of jail free card at all times

totally mage friendly...

It's more on 1.5 second cooldown so you can plan around it. That passive shield is nothing. It's really nothing. Until you play him you won't realize how useless it is. Flash E cc omg! Actual skill and long as fuck cooldown.

What's the duration on Xerath's CC like... 6 secs? And he can just use it. Yasuo needs to hit 2 minions within 5 seconds of each other before he gets all windy for like 2 secs before having to release it to CC someone normally.

You should be best buds with Hashinshin. You have the same completely oblivious views on how champs work. If you are actually telling me that Yasou's shield is useless and that his Q combo is hard to use, then i'm not surprised to see that you're not even ranked on your account, cause you aren't very capable as a player.

except unlike xerath, if he manages to kill you with that instance of "skill" , he's much more gold reliant and once he gets that kill, he's going to achieve his power-spike early and start to snowball out of control

what's the projectile speed on xerath's E ?  also, you chose one of the few mages in the game that actually has non-projectile skills as the competition for yasuo

REALLY?  REALLY?

let's take a look, at level freaking 1, yasuo's shield protects him from ONE HUNDRED damage and it only increases from there at approximately 24 per level

his Q holds its CC stacks for 6 seconds at a time per cast and the ability has no cost associated to it for a cooldown that starts at two thirds of that amount and only decreases the more attack speed you have

XERATH also has no means of defense other than that slow moving projectile that can only hit ONE target

Yasuo is melee and has no ranged basic attacks. If he wants that canon minion he has to be in MELEE range. He also has an AP champs amount of health. The 100 damage shield is just a way to balance him against the ranged champs he faces in that lane. It is also why he has windwall which btw takes an ability slot. He can only really do damage with Q and ult. It's why he gets wrecked in toplane. His defensive options aren't that good. I chose the AP midlaner at random. Fine then Syndra... uhhh Mordekaiser?

She starts the Q cast does the wave and boom yasuo can't move. Do a rotation on your abilities and he's dead if you actually harassed properly and payed attention to him. Mordekaiser W wrecks yasuo because yasuo is a melee champ and has to be near minions to cs.

First regarding his Q he has to hit two minions prior. This limits him from using it twice in a fight like your average midlaner. Second it's very predictable. He's literally surrounded in wind and you know he has to use it in the next 5 secs or he'll lose it. You can't tell when AP midlaners are about to throw out hearts or flashes of light to bind you.

Also Xerath does have defense. Save your stun for when he tries to jump on you, then walk away.

mordekaiser hasn't been a midlaner in forever because his range and IMMOBILE nature don't let him contest any mid-laner EXCEPT YASUO and very, very few others, of which I think swain is the only one I can think of, maybe kennen...both of which are better top lane...

Yasuo can even COMPLETELY NEGATE SYNDRA'S ULTIMATE with his windwall... and if she pushes the wave, do you really want to be pushed in against a mobile, aggressive melee with crowd control and wave clear?

I still play mordekaiser mid.
Fizz can negate syndra and so can vlad. Irelia can reduce the damage by quite a bit as well. If she lands her stun first, which is practically instant if both Q and E are up, she can land her ult on anyone.

You can freeze the lane and harass at the same time.

certainlyT has a real problem: he has amazing ideas and his creations revolve around a strong theme and are the parts of his kits work well together and around that theme, BUT he legit doesnt give a sh*t about the enviroment of those champions/reworks.
2 examples: 
i love playing the WW rework: it is the chase, hunt them down. everything works so well together: the w into ult, the q to follow up.
But playing against a ww is pure cancer: 
1. you cant get low or he will find and kill you 
2. burst is ass against him. he presses e and your dmg is gone.
3. but long fights with dps doesnt work well against him either. his healing with q and passive is brutal and his q/w will destroy you.
when the ww gets ahead, he will invate you for ever and you cant to shit until his "bad" scaling kicks in (but only if you are a good dualist jungler).

lets talk about the greatest mistake: yasuo.
when i talk to friends who actual play him, they always cant stop telling me how fun he is. this perma 1vs5 feeling seems to be strong.
but when you look at his counterplay, you will find a champ with strong laning phase in most matchups and a disgusting lategame scaling.
BTW: his skillcap declines with game duration. i respect a yasuo outplay in lane, but killing someone with an e and 3 autos is NO display of skill at all.

certainlyT gets the most stick from players, who are forced to play against his creations, while players maining his champs will love him for ever. he is pretty polarising.
for me: i really really really hate yasuo, but the worst shit in this game isnt his fault: tryndamere, shaco and lulu.

Zoe's E was THE most overloaded spell in the entire game upon her release which required one of, if not the most heavy gutting the LoL has seen so far to put it in line, and currently still is one of the most loaded spell in the game. And her W is still the most un-balance-able spell in the entire game precisely because it's way too RNG oriented over too vast numbers of possibilities; think why Unstable Portal breaks Hearthstone's competitiveness, and that's Zoe's W. And there's her Q, which is basically the old Nid's Q, which you know, was the reason why she was reworked?

Zoe balanced? Hahaha, what a laugh! Her core design itself is broken, my dude, there is nothing that will change the fact that she's way too _fundamentally_ broken.

> And there's her Q, which is basically the old Nid's Q, which you know, was the reason why she was reworked?

> Zoe's E was THE most overloaded spell in the entire game upon her release which required one of, if not the most heavy gutting

You have no idea how release Xin Jhao or Juggernaut-patch Skarner were… The only "gutting" the bubble got is being made cleanseable and the trap being a bit smaller.

Besides, how is the spell overloaded? It's a lesser stun with unreliable damage that lets you reposition before it procs.

> [{quoted}](name=Wolfeur,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VQOVWG1z,comment-id=000c0000000000000000,timestamp=2018-07-18T20:05:29.774+0000)

Xin and Skarner were broken because of questionable stats, that is completely different to Zoe whose broken-ness come from the design of the champion itself. And in the case of Skarner, I suppose we can say he has 1 spell that can be considered a balance problem; but then again Zoe has 3.

On the topic of E as you brought up, I'll list you precisely why Zoe's E, especially on release, was completely busted. it had:

* Okay damage when hit
* it "slows" the target for 2 seconds. I'll get to this
* it then stuns the target for another 2 seconds (if not attacked), so a total of a 4 second CC
* the slow/drowsy used to have a slow that's a maximum of 70%. So it was basically a 2 second root that transition to a 2 second stun when leveled.
* the stunned target then take the next hit with an maximum of double damage
* the spell's range is also doubled when going through terrain
* if Zoe fails to land her E, it will become a trap that is wide enough to completely block jungle paths, for 4 seconds. The trap applies the spell effect to anybody that walks and dashes through it.
* if Zoe hits her E,  all of the previous effects barring the trap component would apply, it would also partially reset the ability's CD. The spell already had merely a medium level CD for all of this, but no, it also needed a reset apparently.
 * The reset component also used to trigger on ALL targets, so even hitting minions would give the partial reset.
* Lastly, Zoe's E also used to be UN-CLEANSE-ABLE as part of its INTENDED feature.

Tell me how that's not busted.

....

And again, there's her "Unstable Portal" W, which is self-explanatory. And her Q exhibits almost all of the problems old Nid used to have, especially after level 6 with her ulti.

Zoe's design itself is fundamentally broken. It's pretty crystal clear.

Do you realize how we can see it through another lens?

> * it then stuns the target for another 2 seconds (if not attacked), so a total of a 4 second CC

The CC is not as effective as a regular stun because it lets you reposition, and prepare your cleanse. You can also blink, dash, zhonya, shield, heal preventively because you *know* she's going to attack when the stun kicks in. Plus, the stun stops as soon as you take damage, requiring good coordination, and no use of DoTs.

> * the stunned target then take the next hit with an maximum of double damage

The spell deals only its full damage if sufficient damage is dealed afterwards. Otherwise, it just deals half damage.

> * the spell's range is also doubled when going through terrain

The spell has a limited range when not going through terrain, forcing it to be used in a less reliable way, and then needing movement abilities to reach the far target.
The projectile is also not that fast, and has a pretty telegraphed cast animation.

> * if Zoe fails to land her E, it will become a trap

The spell lands a trap that is instead automatically proc'd if the projectile hits mid-course.

> * Lastly, Zoe's E also used to be UN-CLEANSE-ABLE as part of its INTENDED feature.

The CCs were considered as separate, but cleansing was still easier because you had a 2-sec window to react to it. Now you can cleanse the drowsy and negate the sleepy altogether.

> And again, there's her "Unstable Portal" W, which is self-explanatory.

The RNG is very much controlled to avoid abuse (like the "no-teleport" rule), and it's pretty clear what's going to happen. The shard is visible for everyone, and you can know what spell she has.

Zoe was problematic at first, but nothing that some tweaking couldn't resolve. The kit was balanceable (albeit OP) and it has been balanced.

> [{quoted}](name=Wolfeur,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VQOVWG1z,comment-id=000c000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-07-18T20:52:48.633+0000)
>
> Zoe was problematic at first, but nothing that some tweaking couldn't resolve. The kit was balanceable (albeit OP) and it has been balanced.

Her E is the lesser evil in her kit; the fact her "lesser evil" is only solvable by slashing out almost 2/3 of the ability after launch is already pretty telling.

But the biggest evil is her W. Her W will NEVER be balanced, in the same way how Unstable Portal forever ruins Hearthstone.

She is either use-able and straight up becomes OP, and even if she's not she is still an excruciating annoying pick to play against for a myriad of reasons (her Q,W,E are all extremely annoying for her opponent to deal with, so that's like her entire existence itself). Or she has to be balanced to be intentionally underpowered and irrelevant in general, which ofc, is a very clear sign that the champion's design is incredibly off.

Her design is broken to the very core. She will never be remotely balanced, as a matter of fact. The only way to truly balance her is if Riot completely remakes her, given unlike other designs that have warranted reworks where mostly it's about 1 core ability in the kit being broken and fundamentally un-balance-able, her entire kit is that way. 

Zoe was a mistake. No doubt about it.
